definition: sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
border/horizon/shore

sentences.english: Way before the book dry hills and a net is short stunt for porridge.
sentences.chinese: 書山有路先幹爲淨，學海無涯八寶作粥。

sentences.english: Mountain road to the book for the track, learning is endless suffering for the boat.
sentences.chinese: 書山有路勤爲徑，學海無涯苦作舟。用英語怎麼寫？

sentences.english: There is a road to Xiangan king, eight porridge for There is no end for learning.
sentences.chinese: 書山有路先乾爲敬，學海無涯八寶作粥。

sentences.english: There is no end in learning. A lot of efforts are needed for final achievement.
sentences.chinese: 學海無涯苦作舟，想要學業有成必須經過一番努力。

sentences.english: Life is limited, knowledge is oceanic, selective learning is very important.
sentences.chinese: 人生有限，學海無涯，懂得選擇性吸取知識至爲重要。

sentences.english: With so many things yet to learn, Venus plans to pursue a Master's degree after graduation.
sentences.chinese: 她有感學海無涯，打算繼續深造碩士課程。

sentences.english: Learned people know they can never learn enough.
sentences.chinese: 有學識的人知道學海無涯。

definition: to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
toil/hard work
study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
to comprehend (new things) by analogy

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education
loyal/sincere/sound
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
to be successful in every endeavor
(literary) hypocrite/two-faced person
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
scholastic attainments
to be content with what one is
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
